results.title: Effect of locally applied simvastatin on clinical attachment level and alveolar bone in periodontal maintenance patients: A randomized clinical trial
results.text_hl: Further research is needed to explore the effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@ when applied to residual pockets in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who have already undergone initial therapy and are receiving @<m>DISEASE_Periodontitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010518 @@@PMT@@@.

citations.NLM: Killeen AC, Krell LE, Bertels M, Christiansen MM, Anderson L, Hattervig RL, Samson KK, Wang D, Reinhardt RA. PMID: 35622060

results.title: Statins and oral biofilm: simvastatin as a promising drug to control periodontal dysbiosis.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ showed antimicrobial and antibiofilm activity against oral bacteria and may contribute to the control of dysbiosis, and may be considered in clinical studies as an adjuvant in the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Periodontitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010518 @@@periodontitis@@@.

citations.NLM: Parolina de Carvalho RD, de Andrade Moreno J, Roque SM, Chan DCH, Torrez WB, Stipp RN, Bueno-Silva B, de Lima PO, Cogo-Müller K. Statins and oral biofilm: simvastatin as a promising drug to control periodontal dysbiosis. Oral Dis. 2022 Nov 23;():. PMID: 36416468

results.title: Discovering common pathogenetic processes between periodontitis and Alzheimer's disease by bioinformatics and system biology approach.
results.text_hl: Importantly, @CHEMICAL_Glutathione @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005978 @@@glutathione@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Dexamethasone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003907 @@@dexamethasone@@@ were identified as important candidate drugs for the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Periodontitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010518 @@@PT@@@ and @DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@AD@@@.

citations.NLM: Ge F, Zhao Y, Zheng J, Xiang Q, Luo P, Zhu L, He H. Discovering common pathogenetic processes between periodontitis and Alzheimer's disease by bioinformatics and system biology approach. BMC Oral Health. 2024 Sep 12;24(1):1074. PMID: 39266981

results.title: Simvastatin prevents alveolar bone loss in an experimental rat model of periodontitis after ovariectomy
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ prevents @DISEASE_Alveolar_Bone_Loss @DISEASE_MESH:D016301 @@@alveolar bone loss@@@ in an experimental @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ model of @<m>DISEASE_Periodontitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010518 @@@periodontitis@@@ after ovariectomy

results.title: Simvastatin attenuates tibial bone loss in rats with type 1 diabetes and periodontitis
results.text_hl: Additionally, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@ treatment resulted in improved radiographic defect depth in @<m>DISEASE_Periodontitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010518 @@@periodontitis@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

results.title: Effect of Simvastatin Prodrug on Experimental Periodontitis.
results.text_hl: BACKGROUND: Local application of statins has shown potential in preventing and regenerating @DISEASE_Bone_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D001847 @@@bone loss@@@ associated with experimental @<m>DISEASE_Periodontitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010518 @@@periodontitis@@@. This study evaluates the effect of a novel @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@) prodrug (capable of delivering high doses to @<m>DISEASE_Periodontitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010518 @@@periodontitis@@@ @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory lesion@@@ and cells) on experimental @<m>DISEASE_Periodontitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010518 @@@periodontitis@@@ @DISEASE_Bone_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D001847 @@@bone loss@@@ and @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@.

citations.NLM: Bradley AD, Zhang Y, Jia Z, Zhao G, Wang X, Pranke L, Schmid MJ, Wang D, Reinhardt RA. Effect of Simvastatin Prodrug on Experimental Periodontitis. J Periodontol. 2016 May;87(5):577-82. PMID: 26799395
